meanings.definition: To call or name someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I was cleping my friend to come over for dinner.
meanings.sent2: She cleped out to her dog to come inside.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cleping for attention by knocking things off the table.
meanings.sent4: The teacher cleped the students to attention before starting the lesson.
meanings.sent5: The bird's song cleped out through the quiet morning.

meanings.definition: The act of naming or calling someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His cleping of the new species was recognized by the scientific community.
meanings.sent2: The cleping of the baby by its parents brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent3: The cleping of the ship was done with great ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The cleping of the winner was met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent5: The cleping of the mountain by the locals gave it a sense of identity.
